definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Cousin saw a group of couples in cloaks soak their souls in the soapy soup.
sentences.chinese: 表哥瞧见一群穿着大氅的匹俦正在胰子汤里浸泡灵魂。

sentences.english: Love keeps the cold out better than a cloak.
sentences.chinese: 爱能驱走严寒，比大氅更管用。

sentences.english: Wrap thy form in a mantle grey.
sentences.chinese: 用灰色的大氅裹你外形。

sentences.english: A borrowed cloak does not keep one warm.
The angel tells Joseph to take Mary and Jesus and return to Nazareth .
sentences.chinese: 天使告诉连帽大氅带玛丽和耶稣和回到拿撒勒。

definition: coat/jacket/short and lined coat or robe
fur-lined changpao 長袍|长袍[chang2 pao2]
evil spirit/goblin/witchcraft/variant of 妖[yao1]/common erroneous variant of 祆[Xian1] Ormazda
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
black (without gloss)/black with a hint of red in it
